lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Douglas Lasken sheds more heat than light in ''It's Time to Abandon Bilingual Education'' (Op-Ed, Jan. 13). It is true that bilingual failures abound, especially in the Los Angeles school district, where he teaches. This is because for bilingual education to work, the students need to be properly selected, the program needs to be practiced consistently, resources need to be available and transitioning to English needs to be done at the proper pace. When these conditions are in place, the program often works.
abstract: Larry Wiener letter disputes Doglas Lasken's January 13 Op-Ed article urging abandonment of bilingual education programs in California and elsewhere (S)
